summary: Academic dishonesty in higher education refers to any form of cheating, plagiarism, or other unethical behavior that a student engages in to gain an unfair advantage in their academic pursuits. This behavior is considered a violation of the academic integrity and can lead to serious consequences, including failure of the assignment or course, suspension, or even expulsion from the institution. Academic dishonesty can take many forms, including but not limited to, copying someone else's work and presenting it as one's own, using unauthorized sources, taking exams without permission, fabricating data, and using technology to cheat on exams or assignments. It is important for students to understand the severity of academic dishonesty and the importance of maintaining academic integrity throughout their academic careers.
